005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * A base class for a field that is a member of a containing model.
015 *
016 * @param <PARENT>
017 *          the Java type of the parent model (i.e., assembly, choice,
018 *          choiceGroup).
019 * @param <DEFINITION>
020 *          the Java type of the definition for this member field
021 * @param <INSTANCE>
022 *          the Java type of the instance for this member field
023 * @param <PARENT_DEFINITION>
024 *          the Java type of the containing assembly definition
025 */
026public abstract class AbstractFieldInstance<
027    PARENT extends IContainerModel,
028    DEFINITION extends IFieldDefinition,
029    INSTANCE extends IFieldInstance,
030    PARENT_DEFINITION extends IAssemblyDefinition>
031    extends AbstractNamedModelInstance<PARENT, PARENT_DEFINITION>
032    implements IFieldInstance, IFeatureDefinitionReferenceInstance<DEFINITION, INSTANCE> {
033
034  /**
035   * Construct a new field instance.
036   *
037   * @param parent
038   *          the parent model containing this instance
039   */
040  protected AbstractFieldInstance(@NonNull PARENT parent) {
041    super(parent);
042  }
043
044  @Override
045  public DEFINITION getDefinition() {
046    IEnhancedQName qname = getReferencedDefinitionQName();
047    // this should always be not null
048    IFieldDefinition definition = getContainingModule().getScopedFieldDefinitionByName(qname.getIndexPosition());
049    if (definition == null) {
050      throw new ModelInitializationException(
051          String.format("Unable to resolve field reference '%s' in definition '%s' in module '%s'",
052              qname,
053              getParentContainer().getOwningDefinition().getName(),
054              getContainingModule().getShortName()));
055    }
056    return ObjectUtils.asType(definition);
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Generates a "coordinate" string for the assembly instance.
061   *
062   * @return the coordinate
063   */
064  @SuppressWarnings("null")
065  @Override
066  public String toCoordinates() {
067    IDefinition definition = getDefinition();
068    return String.format("field instance %s -> %s in module %s (@%d(%d)",
069        getQName(),
070        definition.getDefinitionQName(),
071        getContainingDefinition().getContainingModule().getShortName(),
072        hashCode(),
073        definition.hashCode());
074  }
075}
